arabicText: قَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَآ أَمَتَّنَا ٱثْنَتَيْنِ وَأَحْيَيْتَنَا ٱثْنَتَيْنِ فَٱعْتَرَفْنَا بِذُنُوبِنَا فَهَلْ إِلَىٰ خُرُوجٍۢ مِّن سَبِيلٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
They	will	say,	“O	Our	Lord!	Twice	You	have	
given	us	death	and	twice	You	have	given	us	
life	*	-	we	now	confess	to	our	sins	-	so	is	
there	a	way	out	of	the	fire?”	(From	
nothingness	to	life	in	this	world,	to	death	
and	then	Resurrection.)		”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kaheñ	ge	aey	hamāre	Rab	tu	ne	hameñ	do	
bār	murda	kiyā	aur	do	bār	zinda	kiyā	ab	
ham	apne	gunāhoñ	par	muqir	huye	to	āag	
se	nikalne	ki	bhi	koyi	rāh	hai.

arabicText: ذَٰلِكُم بِأَنَّهُۥٓ إِذَا دُعِىَ ٱللَّهُ وَحْدَهُۥ كَفَرْتُمْ ۖ وَإِن يُشْرَكْ بِهِۦ تُؤْمِنُوا۟ ۚ فَٱلْحُكْمُ لِلَّهِ ٱلْعَلِىِّ ٱلْكَبِيرِ
englishTranslationText:
“This	has	occurred	because	when	Allah	the	
One	was	prayed	to,	you	used	to	disbelieve;	
and	when	a	partner	was	ascribed	with	
Him,	you	used	to	believe;	so	the	command	
is	only	for	Allah,	the	Supreme,	the	Great.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	is	par	huā	ke	jab	aik	Allāh	pukārā	jātā	
to	tum	kufr	karte	aur	us	kā	sharik	thahrāyā	
jātā	to	tum	mān	lete	to	ḥukm	Allāh	ke	liye	
hai	jo	sab	se	buland	badā.

arabicText: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُرِيكُمْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ وَيُنَزِّلُ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ رِزْقًۭا ۚ وَمَا يَتَذَكَّرُ إِلَّا مَن يُنِيبُ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	He	Who	shows	you	His	signs,	and	sends	down	sustenance	from	the	sky	for	you;	and	none	
accept	guidance	except	those	who	incline	(towards	Him).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wohi	hai	ke	tumheñ	apni	nishāniyāñ	
dikhātā	hai	aur	tumhāre	liye	āasmān	se	rozi	utārtā	hai	aur	nasiḥat	nahiñ	manta	magar	jo	ruju’		
lāye.

arabicText: فَٱدْعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText: Therefore	worship	Allah,	as	His	sincere	bondmen	even	if	the	disbelievers	get	annoyed.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	Allāh	ki	bandagi	karo	nire	us	ke	bande	ho	kar	pade	burā	mane	kāfir.

arabicText: رَفِيعُ ٱلدَّرَجَـٰتِ ذُو ٱلْعَرْشِ يُلْقِى ٱلرُّوحَ مِنْ أَمْرِهِۦ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَآءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦ لِيُنذِرَ يَوْمَ ٱلتَّلَاقِ
englishTranslationText:
Bestower	of	High	Ranks,	Owner	of	the	Throne;	it	is	He	Who	instils	the	spirit	of	faith	into	the	one	
He	wills	among	His	bondmen,	in	order	that	he	may	warn	of	the	Day	of	Meeting.	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Buland	darje	dene	wālā	ársh	kā	mālik	Imān	ki	jān	(ya'ani)	waḥi	dāltā	hai	apne	ḥukm	se	apne	
bandoñ	meiñ	jis	par	chāhe	ke	woh	milne	ke	din	se	darāye.

arabicText: يَوْمَ هُم بَـٰرِزُونَ ۖ لَا يَخْفَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مِنْهُمْ شَىْءٌۭ ۚ لِّمَنِ ٱلْمُلْكُ ٱلْيَوْمَ ۖ لِلَّهِ ٱلْوَٰحِدِ ٱلْقَهَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
A	day	when	they	will	be	fully	exposed;	nothing	from	their	affairs	will	be	hidden	from	Allah;	“For	
whom	is	the	kingship	this	day?	For	Allah,	the	One,	the	All	Dominant.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	din	woh	bilkul	zāhir	ho	jāyeñ	ge	Allāh	par	un	kā	kuchh	ḥāl	chipā	na	hogā	āaj	kis	ki	bādshāhi	
hai	aik	Allāh	sab	par	ghālib	ki.

arabicText: ٱلْيَوْمَ تُجْزَىٰ كُلُّ نَفْسٍۭ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ ۚ لَا ظُلْمَ ٱلْيَوْمَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَرِيعُ ٱلْحِسَابِ
englishTranslationText:
This	day	each	soul	will	be	repaid	for	what	
it	has	earned;	no	one	will	be	wronged	this	
day;	indeed	Allah	is	Swift	At	Taking	
Account.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Āaj	har	jān	apne	kiye	kā	badla	pāye	gi	āaj	
kisi	par	ziyādati	nahiñ	be-shak	Allāh	jald	
ḥisāb	lene	wālā	hai.

arabicText: وَأَنذِرْهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْـَٔازِفَةِ إِذِ ٱلْقُلُوبُ لَدَى ٱلْحَنَاجِرِ كَـٰظِمِينَ ۚ مَا لِلظَّـٰلِمِينَ مِنْ حَمِيمٍۢ وَلَا شَفِيعٍۢ يُطَاعُ
englishTranslationText:
And	warn	them	of	the	day	of	impending	
calamity,	when	hearts	will	rise	up	to	the	
throats	filled	with	grief;	and	the	
disbelievers	will	have	neither	any	friend	
nor	any	intercessor	who	will	be	obeyed.	
(Intercession	will	be	accepted	only	for	the	
Muslims,	not	for	the	disbelievers)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unheñ	darāo	us	nazdik	āane	wāli	āafat	
ke	din	se	jab	dil	galoñ	ke	pās	āa	jāyeñ	ge	
gham	meiñ	bhare	aur	zālimoñ	kā	na	koyi	
dost	na	koyi	sifārashi	jis	kā	kahā	mānā	jāye.

arabicText: يَعْلَمُ خَآئِنَةَ ٱلْأَعْيُنِ وَمَا تُخْفِى ٱلصُّدُورُ
englishTranslationText:
Allah	well	knows	the	covert	glance	and	all	
what	lies	hidden	in	the	hearts.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	jāntā	hai	chori	chupe	ki	nigāh	aur	jo	
kuchh	sinoñ	meiñ	chupā	hai.

arabicText: وَٱللَّهُ يَقْضِى بِٱلْحَقِّ ۖ وَٱلَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِۦ لَا يَقْضُونَ بِشَىْءٍ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْبَصِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
And	Allah	renders	the	true	judgement;	and	
those	whom	they	worship	instead	of	Him	
do	not	judge	at	all;	indeed	Allah	only,	is	the	
All	Hearing,	the	All	Seeing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	sachchā	faisla	farmātā	hai	aur	us	
ke	siwā	jink	o	poojte	haiñ	woh	kuchh	faisla	
nahiñ	karte	be-shak	Allāh	hi	suntā	dekhtā	
hai.

arabicText: ۞ أَوَلَمْ يَسِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَيَنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَانُوا۟ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ كَانُوا۟ هُمْ أَشَدَّ مِنْهُمْ قُوَّةًۭ وَءَاثَارًۭا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ بِذُنُوبِهِمْ وَمَا كَانَ لَهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن وَاقٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
So	did	they	not	travel	in	the	land	in	order	
to	see	what	sort	of	fate	befell	those	before	
them?	Their	strength	and	the	signs	they	
left	behind	in	the	earth,	exceeded	them	-	so	
Allah	seized	them	on	account	of	their	sins,	
and	they	had	no	one	to	save	them	from	
Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Kyā		unhoñ	ne	zamin	meiñ	safar	na	Kiyā		
ke	dekhte	kaisā	anjām	huā	un	se	agloñ	kā	
un	ki	quwwat	aur	zamin	meiñ	jo	
nishāniyāñ	chord	gaye	un	se	zāid	to	Allāh	
ne	unheñ	un	ke	gunāhoñ	par	pakda	aur	Allāh	se	un	kā	koyi	bachāne	wālā	na	huā.

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَانَت تَّأْتِيهِمْ رُسُلُهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ فَكَفَرُوا۟ فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ قَوِىٌّۭ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
englishTranslationText:
This	occurred	because	their	Noble	
Messengers	came	to	them	with	clear	signs,	thereupon	they	used	to	disbelieve,	so	Allah	seized	
them;	indeed	Allah	is	All	Powerful,	Severe	in	Punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ya	is	liye	ke	un	ke	pās	un	ke	Rasool	raushan	nishāniyāñ	le	kar	āaye	phir	woh	kufr	karte	to	Allāh	
ne	unheñ	pakdā	be-shak	Allāh	zabardast	sakht	áƶāb	wālā	hai.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مُوسَىٰ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَسُلْطَـٰنٍۢ مُّبِينٍ
englishTranslationText: And	indeed	We	sent	Moosa	with	Our	signs	and	a	clear	proof.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	Mūsā	ko	apni	nishāniyoñ	aur	roshan	sanad	ke	sāth	bhejā.

arabicText: إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَهَـٰمَـٰنَ وَقَـٰرُونَ فَقَالُوا۟ سَـٰحِرٌۭ كَذَّابٌۭ
englishTranslationText: Towards	Firaun	and	Haman	and	Qaroon	–	in	response	they	said,	“(He	is)	a	magician,	a	big	liar!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Fir'aun	aur	Hāmān	aur	Qāron	ki	ṭaraf	to	woh	bole	jādu-gar	hai	badā	jhootā.

arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُم بِٱلْحَقِّ مِنْ عِندِنَا قَالُوا۟ ٱقْتُلُوٓا۟ أَبْنَآءَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مَعَهُۥ وَٱسْتَحْيُوا۟ نِسَآءَهُمْ ۚ وَمَا كَيْدُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ إِلَّا فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	he	brought	the	truth	from	Our	presence	to	them,	they	said,	“Kill	the	sons	of	those	who	
believe	in	him,	and	keep	their	women	alive”;	and	the	evil	scheme	of	the	disbelievers	only	keeps	
wandering	astray.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	woh	un	par	hamāre	pās	se	ḥaq	lāyā	bole	jo	is	par	Imān	lāye	un	ke	bête	qatl	karo	aur	
áurateñ	zinda	rakho	aur	kāfiroñ	kā	dāo	nahiñ	magar	bhataktā	phirtā

arabicText: وَقَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ ذَرُونِىٓ أَقْتُلْ مُوسَىٰ وَلْيَدْعُ رَبَّهُۥٓ ۖ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُبَدِّلَ دِينَكُمْ أَوْ أَن يُظْهِرَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ٱلْفَسَادَ
englishTranslationText:
And	said	Firaun,	“Allow	me	to	kill	Moosa	
and	let	him	pray	to	his	Lord;	I	fear	that	he	
will	change	your	religion	or	cause	chaos	in	
the	land!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	fir'aun	bola	mujhe	chodo	maiñ	Moosā	
ko	qatl	karoñ	aur	woh	apne	rab	ko	pukāre	
maiñ	dartā	hoñ	kahiñ	woh	tumhārā	din	
badal	de	yā	zamin	meiñ	fasād	chamkāye.

arabicText: وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنِّى عُذْتُ بِرَبِّى وَرَبِّكُم مِّن كُلِّ مُتَكَبِّرٍۢ لَّا يُؤْمِنُ بِيَوْمِ ٱلْحِسَابِ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Moosa,	“I	seek	the	refuge	of	mine	and	
your	Lord,	from	every	haughty	person	who	
does	not	believe	in	the	Day	of	Reckoning.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Mūsā	ne	kahā	maiñ	tumhāre	aur	apne	
Rab	ki	panāh	letā	hooñ	har	mutakabbir	se	
ke	ḥisāb	ke	din	par	yaqin	nahiñ	lātā.

arabicText: وَقَالَ رَجُلٌۭ مُّؤْمِنٌۭ مِّنْ ءَالِ فِرْعَوْنَ يَكْتُمُ إِيمَـٰنَهُۥٓ أَتَقْتُلُونَ رَجُلًا أَن يَقُولَ رَبِّىَ ٱللَّهُ وَقَدْ جَآءَكُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ مِن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ وَإِن يَكُ كَـٰذِبًۭا فَعَلَيْهِ كَذِبُهُۥ ۖ وَإِن يَكُ صَادِقًۭا يُصِبْكُم بَعْضُ ٱلَّذِى يَعِدُكُمْ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِى مَنْ هُوَ مُسْرِفٌۭ كَذَّابٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	said	a	Muslim	man	from	the	people	of	
Firaun,	who	used	to	hide	his	faith,	“What!	
You	want	to	kill	a	man	just	because	he	says,	
‘Allah	is	my	Lord’	whereas	he	has	indeed	
brought	clear	signs	to	you	from	your	Lord?	
And	supposedly	if	he	is	speaking	wrongly,	
then	the	calamity	of	wrongful	speech	is	
upon	him;	and	if	he	is	truthful,	then	part	of	
what	he	promises	you	will	reach	you;	
indeed	Allah	does	not	guide	any	
transgressor,	excessive	liar.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bola	fir'aun	wāloñ	meiñ	se	aik	Mard-e
Musalmān	ke	apne	Imān	ko	chupātā	thā	
kyā	aik	mard	ko	is	par	māre	dālte	ho	ke	
woh	kahtā	hai	merā	Rab	Allāh	hai	aur	be
shak	woh	roshan	nishāniyāñ	tumhāre	pās	
tumhāre	Rab	ki	ṭaraf	se	lāye	aur	agar	
bilfarz	woh	ghalaṭ	kahte	haiñ	to	un	ki	
ghalaṭ	goyi	kā	wabāl	un	par	aur	agar	woh	
sachche	haiñ	to	tumheñ	pahuñch	jāye	gā	
kuchh	woh	jis	kā	tumheñ	w'ada	dete	haiñ	
be-shak	Allāh	rāh	nahiñ	detā	usey	jo	ḥad	de	
badhne	wālā	badā	jhoota	ho.

arabicText: يَـٰقَوْمِ لَكُمُ ٱلْمُلْكُ ٱلْيَوْمَ ظَـٰهِرِينَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَمَن يَنصُرُنَا مِنۢ بَأْسِ ٱللَّهِ إِن جَآءَنَا ۚ قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ مَآ أُرِيكُمْ إِلَّا مَآ أَرَىٰ وَمَآ أَهْدِيكُمْ إِلَّا سَبِيلَ ٱلرَّشَادِ
englishTranslationText:
“O	my	people!	You	now	rule	the	earth,	
dominant;	so	who	will	save	us	from	Allah’s	
punishment	if	it	comes	upon	us?”	Said	
Firaun,	“I	only	explain	to	you	what	I	think	
is	correct,	and	I	show	you	only	the	right	
path.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	meri	qaum	āaj	bādshāhi	tumhāri	hai	is	
zamin	meiñ	ghalba	rakhte	ho	to	Allāh	ke	
áƶāb	se	hameñ	kaun	bachāye	gā	agar	ham	
par	āaye	fir'aun	bola	maiñ	to	tumheñ	wohi	
sujhātā	hooñ	jo	meri	sojh	hai	aur	maiñ	
tumheñ	wohi	batātā	hooñ	jo	bhalāyi	ki	rāh	hai.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِىٓ ءَامَنَ يَـٰقَوْمِ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُم مِّثْلَ يَوْمِ ٱلْأَحْزَابِ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	believer	said,	“O	my	people!	I	fear	
for	you	a	day	similar	to	that	of	the	earlier	
groups!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	woh	Imān	wālā	bola	aey	meri	Qaum	mujhe	tum	par	agle	girohoñ	ke	din	kā	sā	khauf	hai.

arabicText: مِثْلَ دَأْبِ قَوْمِ نُوحٍۢ وَعَادٍۢ وَثَمُودَ وَٱلَّذِينَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِمْ ۚ وَمَا ٱللَّهُ يُرِيدُ ظُلْمًۭا لِّلْعِبَادِ
englishTranslationText:
“Like	the	tradition	of	the	people	of	Nooh,	and	Aad,	and	Thamud	and	others	after	them;	and	Allah	
does	not	will	injustice	upon	bondmen.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jaisā	dastoor	guzrā	Nūḥ	ki	Qaum	aur	'Āad	aur	Samood	aur	un	ke	b'ad	auroñ	kā	aur	Allāh	bandoñ	
par	zulm	nahiñ	chāhtā.

arabicText: وَيَـٰقَوْمِ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلتَّنَادِ
englishTranslationText: “O	my	people!	I	fear	for	you	a	day	on	which	will	be	a	great	outcry!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	aey	meri	qaum	maiñ	tum	par	us	din	se	dartā	hooñ	jis	din	pukār	mache	gi.

arabicText: يَوْمَ تُوَلُّونَ مُدْبِرِينَ مَا لَكُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ مِنْ عَاصِمٍۢ ۗ وَمَن يُضْلِلِ ٱللَّهُ فَمَا لَهُۥ مِنْ هَادٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
“A	day	when	you	will	turn	back	fleeing;	none	can	save	you	from	Allah;	and	whomever	Allah	sends	
astray,	there	is	no	guide	for	him.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	din	pith	de	kar	bhāgo	ge	Allāh	se	tumheñ	koyi	bachāne	wālā	nahiñ	aur	jise	Allāh	gumrāh	kare	
us	kā	koyi	rāh	dikhāne	wālā	nahiñ.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَكُمْ يُوسُفُ مِن قَبْلُ بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ فَمَا زِلْتُمْ فِى شَكٍّۢ مِّمَّا جَآءَكُم بِهِۦ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا هَلَكَ قُلْتُمْ لَن يَبْعَثَ ٱللَّهُ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ رَسُولًۭا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَنْ هُوَ مُسْرِفٌۭ مُّرْتَابٌ
englishTranslationText:
“And	indeed	Yusuf	came	to	you	with	clear	
signs	before	this,	thereupon	you	remained	
doubtful	concerning	what	he	had	brought;	
to	the	extent	that	when	he	died,	you	said,	
‘Allah	will	surely	not	send	any	Noble	
Messenger	after	him’	”;	this	is	how	Allah	
sends	astray	whoever	transgresses,	is	
doubtful.	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	is	se	pahle	tumhāre	pās	Yousuf	
raushan	nishāniyāñ	le	kar	āaye	to	tum	un	
ke	lāye	huye	se	shak	hi	meiñ	rahe	yahāñ	
tak	ke	jab	unhoñ	ne	intiqāl	farmāyā	tum	
bole	hargiz	ab	Allāh	koyi	Rasool	na	bheje	
gā	Allāh	yuñhi	gumrāh	kartā	hai	usey	jo	
ḥad	se	badhne	wālā	shak	lāne	wālā	hai.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ يُجَـٰدِلُونَ فِىٓ ءَايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ بِغَيْرِ سُلْطَـٰنٍ أَتَىٰهُمْ ۖ كَبُرَ مَقْتًا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَعِندَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَطْبَعُ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ قَلْبِ مُتَكَبِّرٍۢ جَبَّارٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	dispute	regarding	the	signs	of	
Allah	without	any	proof	having	come	to	
them;	how	very	disgusting	this	is,	in	the	
sight	of	Allah	and	in	the	sight	of	the	
believers!	This	is	how	Allah	seals	the	entire	
heart	of	every	haughty,	rebellious	person.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jo	Allāh	ki	Āayatoñ	meiñ	jhagdā	karte	
haiñ	be	kisi	sanad	ke	ke	unheñ	mili	ho	kis	
qadr	sakht	bezāri	ki	bāt	hai	Allāh	ke	nadik	
aur	Imān	wāloñ	ke	nazdik	Allāh	yuñ	hi	
muhar	detā	hai	mutakabbir	sarkash	ke	
sāre	dil	par.

arabicText: وَقَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ يَـٰهَـٰمَـٰنُ ٱبْنِ لِى صَرْحًۭا لَّعَلِّىٓ أَبْلُغُ ٱلْأَسْبَـٰبَ
englishTranslationText:
And	said	Firaun,	“O	Haman!	Build	a	high	
palace	for	me,	in	order	that	I	may	reach	the	
routes.”	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Fir'aun	bola	aey	Hāmān	mere	liye	
ooñchā	maḥal	banā	shāyad	maiñ	pahuñch	
jāoñ	rāstoñ	tak.
